content: Zimbabwe’s central bank is again issuing gold coins it scrapped 10 months ago, a step it took to ramp up the bullion stockpile used to back up the local currency, the ZiG.

title: China to Brief on Policies to Stabilize Employment, Growth
content: China will hold a press conference about policies and measures on stabilizing employment, ensuring stable growth and promoting high-quality development on Monday.

title: Israeli Economy at Risk From Tariffs, Central Bank Chief Says
content: Israel’s central bank said that US-imposed tariffs are affecting the Jewish state’s economy as markets and tech investments come under risk.

title: India’s Economy to Grow 6.5% Despite Global Swings, RBI Says
content: India’s economy is likely to expand 6.5% this year, making it the fastest-growing major economy in the world despite the rise in global uncertainties, according to the nation’s central bank.

title: Shein Hikes US Prices as Much as 377% Ahead of Tariff Increases
content: Fast-fashion giant Shein Group Ltd. raised US prices of its products from dresses to kitchenware ahead of imminent tariffs on small parcels, in an early sign of the potential effect of the trade war on American consumers.

title: ECB’s Centeno Says Uncertainty Is Dominating Economic Analysis
content: European Central Bank Governing Council member Mario Centeno said economic analysis is currently dominated by “uncertainty” created largely by US trade policy, Jornal de Negocios reported, citing an interview.

title: China Widens Tax Rebates for Foreign Tourists to Boost Spending
content: China said it will lower the tax rebate threshold for foreigners visiting the country, an effort to boost consumption as Beijing attempts to offset some of the damage of the trade war.

title: ASX to Review Listing, Waiver Rules After James Hardie Deal
content: The Australian Stock Exchange will review requirements for shareholder approvals in mergers and acquisitions, following James Hardie Industries Plc’s A$14 billion ($9 billion) deal in March to take over AZEK Co.

title: BSP Says FX Intervention Targets Inflation, Not Capital Flows
content: The Philippine central bank said its periodic intervention in currency markets would be aimed at stemming inflationary pressures if the peso was to weaken, but that it’s not trying to manage capital flows into and out of the country.

title: Hong Kong Hotels in High Demand for ‘Golden Week,’ Ta Kung Pao Reports
content: Hong Kong hotels are in high demand for China’s upcoming “Golden Week,” with many already almost fully booked, Ta Kung Pao reported.

title: China March Industrial Profits Rise, Defying Trade Tensions
content: Profits at China’s industrial firms rebounded in March, driven by a boost in income from the high-technology manufacturing sector and signaling economic resilience amid trade tensions with the US.

title: BOK’s Rhee Says Trend Is for Policy Rate to be Lower: Yonhap
content: Bank of Korea Governor Rhee Chang-yong said the trajectory of the central bank’s key interest rate is for it to be lower because of stable inflation, even as a cautious approach is maintained on monetary policy, Yonhap News Agency  reported.

title: Global Money Managers Are Reluctant to Return to Chinese Stocks
content: Signs of a softening stance from the US on China tariffs may be a cue to buy the Asian nation’s stocks for some traders, but for long-term global funds the risk is still too high to pile into the market.

title: IMF Suspends Colombia’s Flexible Credit Line on Fiscal Concerns
content: The International Monetary Fund suspended on Saturday Colombia’s flexible credit line due to the lack of measures to reduce public deficit and debt, which have risen more than expected in the fund’s eyes.

title: Private Credit’s Cracks Widened Before Turmoil
content: The companies that get private credit loans are looking increasingly wobbly and banks are among those that could eventually be on the hook for losses.

title: PM Mark Carney on Trump's Desire For Canada 51st State
content: Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney told reporters on the final weekend before national elections that he takes seriously the president’s stated desire to turn the country into a US state. He said “Take what the president says literally.” (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Tesla Hikes Canadian Prices and Pushes Its Pre-Tariff Inventory
content: Tesla Inc. is raising prices in Canada and encouraging buyers to snap up cars imported before counter-tariffs were imposed on US-made vehicles.

title: ECB Launches New Task Force to Simplify Banking Regulation
content: The European Central Bank has convened a task force led by some of its most powerful governors aimed at simplifying banking regulation, amid growing fears the region is falling behind.

title: Canadian Prime Minister Carney on US Negotiations
content: Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney said he expects US President Donald Trump will try to extract “major concessions” from Canada in negotiations, and that he takes seriously the president’s stated desire to turn the country into a US state. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Thousands Gather for Pope Francis Funeral Service
content: Thousands of people attended the funeral service for Pope Francis on Saturday morning in St. Peter's Square at the Vatican, before the late leader of the Catholic Church was transported to the Papal Basilica of St. Mary Major (Santa Maria Maggiore) in Rome to be buried. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Trump Is Aiming for Big Concessions on Trade, Carney Warns Canada Voters
content: Mark Carney said he expects US President Donald Trump will try to extract “major concessions” from Canada in negotiations, and that he takes seriously the president’s stated desire to turn the country into a US state.

title: CMA CGM Acquires Turkish Logistics Company for $440 Million
content: Turkish conglomerate Borusan sold its logistics and supply chain solutions firm to French shipping giant CMA CGM SA for $440 million, according to a statement dated Saturday.

title: ECB’s Simkus Says Two More Cuts Possible as Trade Hurts Economy
content: The European Central Bank may have to lower interest rates further as US tariffs weigh on economic growth and inflation continues to slow, according to Governing Council member Gediminas Simkus.

title: Ackman Says Time Is Friend of US, Enemy of China in Trade War
content: Billionaire hedge fund manager Bill Ackman said China will need to strike a trade deal with the US quickly as it can’t win a drawn-out trade war that will do severe damage to its economy.

title: House GOP Drafts Cuts to Federal Employee Pension System
content: Federal employee pension benefits are set to be pared back in Republicans’ giant tax and spending package working its way through the US House, another slap at a workforce roiled by Elon Musk’s cost-cutting efforts.

title: Australia’s Labor on Track to Win May 3 Election, Poll Shows
content: Australia’s center-left Labor government is on track to win the May 3 national election, according to polling released just hours before Prime Minister Anthony Albanese was declared the winner of the fourth and final leaders’ debate on Sunday night.

title: Iran Still Battling Port Fire as Death Toll, Casualties Rise
content: Iranian authorities on Sunday were still battling to control fire and smoke unleashed by yesterday’s explosion at a key commercial port in the country’s south that state media said left at least 28 people dead and more than 1,200 injured.

title: China to Brief on Policies to Stabilize Employment, Growth
content: China will hold a press conference about policies and measures on stabilizing employment, ensuring stable growth and promoting high-quality development on Monday.

title: Far-Right Bardella to Run for French President If Le Pen Barred
content: Jordan Bardella, the leader of France’s far-right National Rally party, said he would stand for president in the 2027 election if Marine Le Pen was barred from running.

title: Vancouver Police Say Nine Dead After Car Rams Into Crowd
content: Nine people were killed in Vancouver and multiple others were injured after a driver plowed into a large crowd at a street festival on Saturday evening.

title: Former S. Korea Opposition Leader Wins Presidential Nomination
content: Lee Jae-myung, a former leader of South Korea’s main opposition Democratic Party, won the group’s presidential primary on Sunday as he readies to fight again for the country’s top political office.

title: India Test-Fires Missiles as Tension With Pakistan Escalates
content: India said it test-fired missiles, showcasing its capability to hit distant targets, amid growing tension with Pakistan.

title: China Claims Sovereignty Over Disputed Reef in South China Sea
content: China has claimed sovereignty over an uninhabited reef in the South China Sea, according to state media, setting the stage for an escalation of tensions with the Philippines over the disputed area.

title: Singapore Politicians Warn Against Foreign Meddling in Election
content: Singapore’s political leaders are warning against foreign attempts to influence voters in an election campaign, under measures introduced four years ago to guard against external meddling.

title: Trinidad Parties Make Final Pitch on Economy, Crime Before Vote
content: Trinidad and Tobago’s ruling and opposition parties pledged to strengthen the energy-dependent economy and tackle crime in their final election rallies before voters go to the polls on Monday.

title: Man Held Over Theft of Homeland Secretary Noem’s Purse, CNN Says
content: A man has been arrested in connection with the theft on Easter Sunday of Homeland Secretary Kristi Noem’s handbag, CNN reported, citing an unidentified law-enforcement source.

title: Wife of US Coast Guard Member Arrested Over Expired Visa
content: WASHINGTON (AP) — The wife of an active-duty Coast Guardsman was arrested earlier this week by federal immigration authorities inside the family residential section of the U.S. Naval Air Station at Key West, Florida, after she was flagged in a routine security check, officials said Saturday.

title: IMF Suspends Colombia’s Flexible Credit Line on Fiscal Concerns
content: The International Monetary Fund suspended on Saturday Colombia’s flexible credit line due to the lack of measures to reduce public deficit and debt, which have risen more than expected in the fund’s eyes.

title: Trump Says US Ships Need Free Travel Through Panama, Suez Canals
content: President Donald Trump called for “free of charge” passage of American ships through the Panama and Suez canals, renewing his focus of expanding US influence over critical commercial and naval waterways.

title: Chile Finance Chief Optimistic Yet Cautious After US Trade Talks
content: Chile is hopeful yet cautious following trade talks with the US that have begun on solid footing, the nation’s Finance Minister Mario Marcel said in an interview.

title: Trump Jr. Tells East Europe to Pick US Over China for Deals

title: Zelenskiy Has Hopeful Meeting With Trump, Who Then Rebukes Putin

title: Pope Francis’ Funeral Draws Up to 200,000 Mourners to St. Peter’s Square

title: West Texas Immigration Deportations Temporarily Halted by US Judge
content: A federal judge in west Texas joined other courts in temporarily blocking the deportations of Venezuelan immigrants under an 18th-century wartime law known as the Alien Enemies Act.

title: Russia Accuses Ukraine in Bombing Death of General Near Moscow
content: Russia said it arrested a man suspected in the murder of a senior military official near Moscow and claimed that a car bomb had been activated remotely from Ukraine.

title: US-Iran Nuclear Talks Signal Progress, Next Round in Europe
content: The US and Iran reported signs of progress in talks on a deal over Iran’s nuclear program after what the Iranian foreign minister described as increasingly detailed discussions.

title: India Says Troops Responded to Pakistan Shots for Second Day

title: South Africa, Tanzania Talks Prompt Lifting of Farm Imports Ban

title: Trump Held Court at Pope Funeral as Politics, Ritual Mixed
content: St. Peter’s Square erupted in applause for Ukraine’s Volodymyr Zelenskiy. Inside the Basilica, he and Donald Trump huddled with France’s Emmanuel Macron and Britain’s Keir Starmer. The occasion was the funeral of Pope Francis — but the optics were all about the geopolitics of the moment.

title: India Says Pakistani Troops Fired at Positions in Disputed Kashmir
content: SRINAGAR, India (AP) — Pakistani soldiers fired at Indian posts along the highly militarized frontier in disputed Kashmir for a second consecutive night, the Indian military said Saturday, as tensions flared between the nuclear-armed rivals following a deadly attack on tourists last week.

title: Russia Claims Full Control of Kursk Region from Ukraine
content: Russia claims it has completed its efforts to remove Ukrainian forces from the Kursk Region, indicating that Ukraine may have lost an important bargaining chip with Moscow after seven months of holding Russian territory.

title: Simple Funeral for Pope Francis Becomes Conduit to See Trump
content: The funeral for Pope Francis was intended to be a stripped-down affair to honor the simplicity of the man. Instead, the attendance of President Donald Trump has turned it into a high-profile stage for international diplomacy at a moment of geopolitical turmoil.

In other news, the Apple Watch’s blood-oxygen feature remains elusive in the US even as the company touts other health offerings.

title: Trump Tariffs Wave Hits Africa
content: US President Donald Trump's tariff announcements have rattled markets. African states may not be Washington's main targets, but like other regions the new levies are forcing a reconsideration of trade relations. Tariffs of at least 10% will apply to imports out of most countries on the continent. Lesotho is one of the world's 60 countries facing steeper rates of 50% and the African nation is now hoping to launch high-level talks with the United States. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: A Third of Britons Say Financial Anxiety Keeps Them Awake at Night

title: Reid Hoffman on AI Investing, Trade Policy and Doge | Bloomberg Technology
content: Bloomberg’s Caroline Hyde and Ed Ludlow speak with Greylock partner and LinkedIn co-founder Reid Hoffman about AI policy and investing amid global trade tensions. Plus, Kamyl Bazbaz from the privacy-focused search company DuckDuckGo discusses what changes to Google could create a more even playing field in search. And BNP Paribas’s David O'Connor joins to talk about Intel's disappointing first-quarter results. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: DoorDash Offers to Buy UK-Based Deliveroo for $3.6 Billion

content: Fast-fashion giant Shein Group Ltd. raised US prices of its products from dresses to kitchenware ahead of imminent tariffs on small parcels, in an early sign of the potential effect of the trade war on American consumers.

title: Advertising Giants Brace for Tariff-Induced Cuts to Ad Spending
content: Advertising firms are bracing for a pullback in clients’ marketing expenditure, with the outlook for 2025 appearing increasingly muddled for the industry.

title: Trump Says US Ships Need Free Travel Through Panama, Suez Canals
content: President Donald Trump called for “free of charge” passage of American ships through the Panama and Suez canals, renewing his focus of expanding US influence over critical commercial and naval waterways.

title: Tesla Hikes Canadian Prices and Pushes Its Pre-Tariff Inventory
content: Tesla Inc. is raising prices in Canada and encouraging buyers to snap up cars imported before counter-tariffs were imposed on US-made vehicles.

title: ECB Launches New Task Force to Simplify Banking Regulation
content: The European Central Bank has convened a task force led by some of its most powerful governors aimed at simplifying banking regulation, amid growing fears the region is falling behind.

title: Gasoline-Making Unit at Dangote Refinery Is in Maintenance
content: A large fuel-production unit at Nigeria’s Dangote oil refinery is undergoing maintenance, according to a person familiar with the matter.

title: Pirelli Nears Deal to End Control of Chinese Owner: Messaggero
content: Pirelli & C. SpA is nearing an agreement to end main investor Sinochem’s control over the Italian tiremaker as part of a plan to distance itself from China, Italian newspaper il Messaggero reported.

title: Switzerland Inc. Fends Off Activist Cevian With Insurance Merger
content: When Cevian Capital boosted its stake in Swiss insurer Baloise Holding AG last year, insurance firms across Europe got ready for the activist investor to go straight for its usual playbook.

title: UK Government’s Steel Gambit Risks Being Undone by Trade War
content: The immediate crisis at British Steel has passed, but by taking control of the country’s last maker of virgin steel, the UK government has put itself in the crossfire of a global trade war.

title: Tesla Refunds Early India Bookings Signaling Entry Is Near
content: Tesla Inc.’s India office is refunding early bookers of its Model 3, according to emails seen by Bloomberg News, sparking speculation the American electric vehicle maker is nearing a rollout in the world’s third-largest automobile market.

title: Coconuts Get Pricier as Poor Weather Drives Global Shortage
content: When Mohamad Fahmi Faat’s family in Kuala Lumpur prepared only half their usual amount of food for recent Eid al-Fitr celebrations, he blamed an ongoing shortage of coconuts, a staple ingredient in many Asian cuisines.

title: GOP Lawmakers Ready $15 Billion Plan to Fix Air Traffic Control
content: Republican members of the House Transportation and Infrastructure Committee are preparing a $15 billion package to revamp the country’s aging air-traffic control system, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: Bezos-Backed Startup Launches Cheap, US-Made Electric Pickup
content: A Jeff Bezos-backed startup aims to appeal to American car buyers’ patriotism and pocketbooks.

title: Paramount Paid Four CEOs $148 Million Combined Last Year
content: Former Paramount Global Chief Executive Officer Bob Bakish was paid $87 million last year, despite serving in that role for only four months, according to a regulatory filing Friday.

title: Most US States Ok Medicaid Pilot for Sickle Cell Gene Therapies
content: In a speech Friday, Health and Human Services Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. said 35 states have agreed to participate in a federal pilot program aimed at helping Medicaid patients access costly gene therapies for sickle cell disease.

title: Novavax Falls on Report That FDA Wants New Covid Vaccine Trial
content: Novavax Inc. shares fell after the Wall Street Journal reported that US regulators asked the company to conduct another clinical trial of its Covid vaccine.

title: Kenvue Jumps on Report Third Point Has Built Up Its Stake
content: Shares of Kenvue Inc. rose on Friday following a report by the Financial Times that the hedge fund Third Point had built up its stake in the company.

title: Atacadao Investors Approve Acquisition by Parent Carrefour
content: Atacadao SA’s investors approved an acquisition by parent company Carrefour SA in a contentious vote that included opposition from some investors and one prominent proxy adviser.

title: Starbucks Union Says It Rejects Company’s Proposal for 2% Annual Raise Guarantee
content: Starbucks Corp. union delegates voted to reject the company’s latest contract proposal, which organizers say falls short by only guaranteeing annual raises of at least 2%.

title: Analyst’s Kid Grills Pepsi CEO, as ‘Take A Child to Work’ Meets Earnings Season
content: PepsiCo Inc. Chief Executive Officer Ramon Laguarta is used to getting asked about the impact of blockbuster weight-loss drugs on his food company’s business, but the questions aren’t usually coming from a 13-year-old.

title: TA Associates Is Nearing Deal to Buy Stake in Secondaries Firm Kline Hill
content: TA Associates is close to a deal to acquire a significant stake in Kline Hill Partners, a firm focused on secondaries bets, according to a people with knowledge of the matter.

title: Two Ex-Wells Fargo Auditors Reach Settlement With Bank Regulator
content: A key US banking regulator unveiled settlements with two former Wells Fargo & Co. auditors who were alleged to have ties to the bank’s systemic sales-practice misconduct, according to a statement Friday.

title: US Has 884 Measles Cases in 29 States, Death Total Now at Three
content: The US reported Friday that it’s confirmed 884 measles cases this year, an 11% increase from a week ago as the outbreak has now touched more than half the country.

title: Carmakers Will Only Raise Prices to Offset Tariffs as Last Resort, AutoNation Says
content: AutoNation Inc., one of the biggest US car dealership chains, says automakers will only boost sticker prices to offset tariffs as a last resort because they want to protect market share.

title: Amgen Pledges $900 Million, Hundreds of Jobs in Ohio Expansion
content: Amgen Inc. will invest $900 million to expand an Ohio manufacturing facility, the latest drug company to promise increased US production as the White House presses forward with tariffs on pharmaceuticals.

title: London Gatwick Seeks Faster Approval of Plan to Build New Runway
content: London Gatwick Airport is seeking expedited approval for its plan to open a second runway after accepting key conditions set by UK officials for its expansion bid.

title: Shriram Finance to Debut Mobile Wallet, UPI, Aims to Grow Business 15% This Year
content: Shriram Finance Ltd. plans to enter the payments business by offering mobile wallets and prepaid cards as the shadow lender seeks to diversify its offerings and boost earnings.

title: Most Banks Want EU to Delay Trading Book Rules, Industry Poll Says
content: A majority of banks want the EU to postpone the adoption of new trading book rules, a survey shows, heaping pressure on the bloc to follow similar moves in the US and the UK.

title: A court in Ivory Coast removes a former Credit Suisse CEO from the presidential ballot
content: A lawyer says an Ivory Coast court has ruled that former Credit Suisse CEO Tidjane Thiam is not eligible to run for president because of his dual Ivorian-French nationality.

title: Tariffs And The Venture Value Chain: A Blip Or Long-Term Pain?
content: Guest author Rohit Yadav takes us on an exploration of the value chain — VC fundraising, startup fundraising and exits — to see how tariffs are driving both direct and indirect impacts.

title: The Longer IPOs Delay, The Less Likely Debuts Will Happen
content: Over the past couple weeks, as we’ve seen Klarna, StubHub and others delay scheduled pre-IPO roadshows, it appears markets are to blame. But how will delays affect a company's success when it finally makes its debut?

title: Crypto Startup Ripple Buys Hidden Road For $1.25B
content: Crypto payments firm Ripple is acquiring brokerage house Hidden Road for $1.25 billion in one of the biggest M&A deals ever in crypto.

title: Tariffs, Volatility And The Startup Exit Dilemma
content: Even seasoned startup investors today face what feels like a novel turn of events: a potential recession and increasing exit uncertainty due to government-induced volatility, writes guest author Don Butler of Thomvest Ventures.  For an ecosystem that has long awaited the return of robust exit volumes, the uncertainty in the markets sparked by tariffs couldn’t come at a worse time.

title: CoreWeave Closes Flat In First-Day Trading
content: Shares of CoreWeave closed flat at $40 on their first day of trading on the Nasdaq today. Shares had opened at $39 on Friday, a day when the Nasdaq sank 2.7%.

title: CoreWeave Shrinks IPO
content: Cloud computing startup CoreWeave is cutting the size of its IPO, looking for a valuation closer to $23 billion than the roughly $30 billion it had originally targeted.

title: Want To Sell Your Startup Quickly To A Strategic Buyer? Consider This From The Get-Go
content: Whether buying a startup or selling one, there are plenty of steps that need to be considered, writes guest author Murat Abdrakhmanov. In this commentary he provides recommendations to help both buyer and seller reach their strategic and financial goals.

title: The Most-Active, Spendiest Startup Investors Are Lagging Greatly In Lucrative Exits
content: The most active, highest-spending startup investors are leading a lot of large new rounds lately. When it comes to exits, however, things look much, much slower. We used Crunchbase data to examine IPO and M&A exits since 2023 for six firms that regularly top our active lead investor rankings.

title: Forget Startups. Maybe The Most Adaptable Companies Are Those That Last Centuries
content: Building a lasting business can take an exceedingly long time, but it's nothing compared to hundreds of well-known, successful organizations and brands that can trace their roots back not in years or decades but in centuries. Here's a look at a few of them.

title: With Turo Withdrawal, A Slim IPO Pipeline Gets Thinner
content: Peer-to-peer car rental platform Turo became the latest venture unicorn to withdraw plans for a public offering.

title: Adapting The IPO Roadmap For Today’s Market
content: The path to IPO has become slower and more arduous for companies looking for an exit, writes Fiunder Shield's COO Carl Niedbala. In this guest commentary he lays out some effective measures to help founders be prepared when an opportunity presents itself.

title: Q1 Global Startup Funding Posts Strongest Quarter Since Q2 2022 With A Third Going To Massive OpenAI Deal
content: Overall, the first quarter of 2025 marked the strongest one for venture investment since Q2 2022. Funding was up 17% quarter over quarter from the $96 billion reached in Q4 2024.

title: How To Leverage Your Pre-Seed Funding For Rapid And Successful Growth
content: After the pre-seed round is a time for a startup to plan for securing follow-on investments, says guest author Sergei Bogdanov, who shares early-stage funding advice to founders regarding what to do as well as what not to do.

title: Most-Active Startup Investors Spent More In Q1
content: The busiest venture backers upped their game in the recently ended first quarter. Among the 14 most-active post-seed investors, a majority backed more deals in Q1 2025 than they did a year ago.

title: Europe’s VC Funding Stayed Flat In Q1, Even As Healthcare Added A Third
content: Europe’s venture funding plateaued at $12.6 billion in Q1 2025 — flat quarter over quarter and year over year, Crunchbase data shows. Without the sort of outsized AI funding rounds seen in North America in the first quarter, the continent’s share of global funding also fell.

title: Latin America Startup Funding Fell Sequentially In Q1
content: Latin America startup investment declined sequentially in the first quarter of this year, driven by a drop in later-stage dealmaking. Even so, funding was above the depressed levels seen a year ago, and early-stage dealmaking showed signs of strength.

title: SignalFire Closes On $1B To Invest In Applied AI
content: Bay Area-based SignalFire, a data-driven venture firm, has raised $1 billion for its fifth and largest fund, which it will invest in applied AI companies.

title: North America Startup Investment Spiked In Q1 Due To OpenAI, But Seed And Early Stage Fell
content: Despite several big deals that buoyed the numbers, North America early- and seed-stage investment declined to multiquarter lows in Q1, and reported round counts fell across stages.

title: Q1 Global Startup Funding Posts Strongest Quarter Since Q2 2022 With A Third Going To Massive OpenAI Deal
content: Overall, the first quarter of 2025 marked the strongest one for venture investment since Q2 2022. Funding was up 17% quarter over quarter from the $96 billion reached in Q4 2024.

title: 7 Deadly Pitch Deck Sins, According To A VC
content: VC firms receive thousands of pitch decks a year and a typical investor will spend no more than two to three minutes assessing each one. In this guest commentary, investor Michael Tefula of Ada Ventures shares seven of the biggest mistakes that are more likely to land your pitch in the “no, thanks” rejection bin.

title: Far Fewer Seed-Stage Startups Are Graduating To Series A — Raising The Risk Of Failure
content: Companies stalled at the seed stage might be sacrificing growth to get to breakeven, which could further hinder their ability to show the traction needed to get to a Series A.

title: Seed Funding Rose In These Spaces
content: Even as overall seed-stage investment declined in 2024, a few areas saw big gains. This includes the obvious category — AI — as well as a subset of sectors largely focused on automating things that humans currently do. We take a look at four top picks.

title: Seed Funding Fell Hard In These Sectors
content: U.S. seed-stage investment actually declined a bit last year, particularly in a handful of industries including several beset by disappointing performance of startups funded in recent prior years. We take a look.
